page.title: 08TREVONE QUARRY, TREVERVA
page.content: Trevone Quarry is a working quarry. There was a long dusty drive to the quarry. On either side of the drive there were blocks of granite that had faults in them. These faults could not be seen before the stone was cut.The faults were quite clear when it had been cut.This granite could not be used. This quarry does not only process British granite it also uses marble and foreign granite.The granite is used for architectural facings to office blocks and shop fronts. They send 90% of their produce to the city of London and the remainder goes to anywhere in the U.K.,but less than 1% stays in the South West of Britain.
